page.title: 01General Description of Area
page.content: This is an industrialised area which contains two major oil refineries. One of these is owned by Shell and the other by Mobil. These refineries are supplied by tankers which dock at one of the sixteen jetties which are reached by sailing up the Thames. The Shell refinery is in two parts, Shellhaven and Thameshaven.The area called Shellhaven gets its name not from the company but from the shell bar whuch protects the entrance to the creek by which it stands. The Mobil refinery occupies the site of the old village of Coryton and so retains this name. The main access route is the A1014, but direct access to the refineries cannot be gained. At GR7382, some pasture is to be found North of the A1014.
